question: 従兄弟
sourceMnemonic: Remember how <ja>兄弟</ja> means "siblings?" Well when they're siblings you have to <kanji>obey</kanji> they're not your brother or sister, they're your <vocabulary>cousin</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
The entire reading for this is an exception. Sorry about that. Here's a mnemonic to help you:

What are the two defining traits your cousin has? They're good and a child. <ja>いいと子</ja>, or <ja><reading>いとこ</reading></ja> for short. Just remember your good, kid cousin. Your <ja>いとこ</ja> cousin.
